meanings.definition: To utter a loud, harsh cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The little boy yawped in excitement when he saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The crowd yawped with joy as the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The parrot yawped loudly, mimicking the sound of a car alarm.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm yawped angrily, shaking the windows with its powerful roar.
meanings.sent5: The baby yawped in hunger, demanding to be fed immediately.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The yawped of the coyote echoed through the night, sending shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The sudden yawped from the forest startled the hikers on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The yawped of the seagulls overhead made the beach feel alive with sound.
meanings.sent4: The yawped of the fire alarm pierced through the silence of the building.
meanings.sent5: The yawped of the referee's whistle signaled the end of the game.
